014package org.microbean.bean;
015
016import java.lang.constant.Constable;
017import java.lang.constant.ConstantDesc;
018import java.lang.constant.DynamicConstantDesc;
019import java.lang.constant.MethodHandleDesc;
020
021import java.util.ArrayList;
022import java.util.Collections;
023import java.util.List;
024import java.util.Optional;
025
026import java.util.function.Predicate;
027
028import javax.lang.model.element.Element;
029import javax.lang.model.element.ElementKind;
030import javax.lang.model.element.Parameterizable;
031import javax.lang.model.element.TypeElement;
032
033import javax.lang.model.type.ArrayType;
034import javax.lang.model.type.DeclaredType;
035import javax.lang.model.type.IntersectionType;
036import javax.lang.model.type.ReferenceType;
037import javax.lang.model.type.TypeKind;
038import javax.lang.model.type.TypeMirror;
039import javax.lang.model.type.TypeVariable;
040import javax.lang.model.type.WildcardType;
041
042import org.microbean.lang.Lang;
043import org.microbean.lang.TypeAndElementSource;
044
045import static java.lang.constant.ConstantDescs.BSM_INVOKE;
046
047import static org.microbean.bean.ConstantDescs.CD_Assignability;
048
049import static org.microbean.lang.ConstantDescs.CD_TypeAndElementSource;
050
051// Applies CDI assignability semantics to types.
052public final class Assignability implements Constable {
053
054
055  /*
056   * Instance fields.
057   */
058
059
060  private final TypeAndElementSource tes;
061
062
063  /*
064   * Constructors.
065   */
066
067
068  public Assignability() {
069    super();
070    this.tes = Lang.typeAndElementSource();
071  }
072
073  public Assignability(final TypeAndElementSource tes) {
074    super();
075    this.tes = tes == null ? Lang.typeAndElementSource() : tes;
076  }
077
078
079  /*
080   * Instance methods.
081   */
082
083
084  @Override // Constable
085  public final Optional<? extends ConstantDesc> describeConstable() {
086    if (this.tes instanceof Constable c) {
087      return c.describeConstable()
088        .map(tesDesc -> DynamicConstantDesc.of(BSM_INVOKE,
089                                               MethodHandleDesc.ofConstructor(CD_Assignability,
090                                                                              CD_TypeAndElementSource),
091                                               tesDesc));
092    }
093    return Optional.empty();
094  }
095
096  // Is at least one payload assignable to the receiver? That is, does at least one payload "match the receiver" in CDI
097  // parlance?
098  public final boolean oneMatches(final TypeMirror receiver, final Iterable<? extends TypeMirror> payloads) {
099    for (final TypeMirror payload : payloads) {
100      if (matches(receiver, payload)) {
101        return true;
102      }
103    }
104    return false;
105  }
106
107  // Is the payload assignable to the receiver? That is, does the payload "match the receiver", in CDI parlance?
108  public final boolean matches(final TypeMirror receiver, final TypeMirror payload) {
109    // "A bean [an object, not a type] is assignable to a given injection point if:
110    //
111    // "The bean has a bean type [payload] that matches the required type [receiver]. For this purpose..."
112    return switch (receiver.getKind()) {
113      // "...primitive types are considered to match their corresponding wrapper types in java.lang..."
114      case BOOLEAN -> payload.getKind() == TypeKind.BOOLEAN || declaredTypeNamed(payload, "java.lang.Boolean");
115      case BYTE    -> payload.getKind() == TypeKind.BYTE    || declaredTypeNamed(payload, "java.lang.Byte");
116      case CHAR    -> payload.getKind() == TypeKind.CHAR    || declaredTypeNamed(payload, "java.lang.Character");
117      case DOUBLE  -> payload.getKind() == TypeKind.DOUBLE  || declaredTypeNamed(payload, "java.lang.Double");
118      case FLOAT   -> payload.getKind() == TypeKind.FLOAT   || declaredTypeNamed(payload, "java.lang.Float");
119      case INT     -> payload.getKind() == TypeKind.INT     || declaredTypeNamed(payload, "java.lang.Integer");
120      case LONG    -> payload.getKind() == TypeKind.LONG    || declaredTypeNamed(payload, "java.lang.Long");
121      case SHORT   -> payload.getKind() == TypeKind.SHORT   || declaredTypeNamed(payload, "java.lang.Short");
122      // "...and array types are considered to match only if their element types are identical"
123      case ARRAY -> payload.getKind() == TypeKind.ARRAY && identical(elementType(receiver), elementType(payload));
124      case DECLARED -> switch (payload.getKind()) {
125        // "...primitive types are considered to match their corresponding wrapper types in java.lang..."
126        case BOOLEAN -> named((DeclaredType)receiver, "java.lang.Boolean");
127        case BYTE    -> named((DeclaredType)receiver, "java.lang.Byte");
128        case CHAR    -> named((DeclaredType)receiver, "java.lang.Character");
129        case DOUBLE  -> named((DeclaredType)receiver, "java.lang.Double");
130        case FLOAT   -> named((DeclaredType)receiver, "java.lang.Float");
131        case INT     -> named((DeclaredType)receiver, "java.lang.Integer");
132        case LONG    -> named((DeclaredType)receiver, "java.lang.Long");
133        case SHORT   -> named((DeclaredType)receiver, "java.lang.Short");
134        // "Parameterized and raw types [and non-generic classes, and non-array types]..."
135        case DECLARED ->
136          // "...are considered to match if they are identical [undefined]..."
137          identical(receiver, payload) ||
138          // "...or if the bean type [payload] is assignable [see #assignable(TypeMirror, TypeMirror)] to the required
139          // type [receiver]...."
140          assignable((DeclaredType)receiver, (DeclaredType)payload);
141        default -> throw new IllegalArgumentException("Illegal payload kind: " + payload.getKind() + "; payload: " + payload);
142      };
143      default -> throw new IllegalArgumentException("Illegal receiver kind: " + receiver.getKind() + "; receiver: " + receiver);
144    };
145  }
146
147  public final TypeAndElementSource typeAndElementSource() {
148    return this.tes;
149  }
150
151  /*
152   * Private methods.
153   */
154
155  private final boolean assignable(final TypeMirror receiver, final TypeMirror payload) {
156    return switch (payload) {
157      // "A parameterized bean type is considered assignable..."
158      case DeclaredType parameterizedPayload when parameterized(payload) -> switch (receiver) {
159        // "...to a [non-generic class or] raw required type..."
160        case TypeMirror rawReceiver when !generic(receiver) || raw(receiver) -> {
161          // "...if the [non-generic class or] raw types are identical and all type parameters [arguments] of the bean
162          // type are either unbounded type variables or java.lang.Object."
163          yield
164            identical(nonGenericClassOrRawType(rawReceiver), nonGenericClassOrRawType(parameterizedPayload)) &&
165            allTypeArgumentsAre(parameterizedPayload.getTypeArguments(),
166                                ((Predicate<TypeMirror>)Assignability::unboundedTypeVariable).or(Assignability::isJavaLangObject));
167        }
168        // "...to a parameterized required type..."
169        case DeclaredType parameterizedReceiver when parameterized(receiver) -> {
170          // "...if they have identical raw type [really if their declarations/elements are identical]..."
171          if (identical(rawType(receiver), rawType(parameterizedPayload))) {
172            // "...and for each parameter [type argument] [pair]..."
173            final List<? extends TypeMirror> rtas = parameterizedReceiver.getTypeArguments();
174            final List<? extends TypeMirror> ptas = parameterizedPayload.getTypeArguments();
175            assert rtas.size() == ptas.size();
176            for (int i = 0; i < rtas.size(); i++) {
177              final TypeMirror rta = rtas.get(i);
178              final TypeMirror pta = ptas.get(i);
179              // "...the required type parameter [argument] and the bean type parameter [argument] are actual [non-type
180              // variable, non-wildcard reference] types..."
181              if (actual(rta)) {
182                if (actual(pta)) {
183                  // "...with identical [non-generic classes or] raw type[s]..."
184                  if (identical(nonGenericClassOrRawType(rta), nonGenericClassOrRawType(pta))) {
185                    // "...and, if the type [?] is parameterized [?]..."
186                    //
187                    // Let rta and pta be array types with parameterized element types, such as List<Number>[] and
188                    // List<String>[]. Then their raw types are List[] and List[]. Their parameterized element types are
189                    // List<Number> and List<String>. According to the JLS, neither List<Number>[] nor List<String>[] is
190                    // parameterized.
191                    //
192                    // In this example, if we get here, we have only proven that List[] is "identical" to List[].
193                    //
194                    // The "if the type is parameterized" clause is tough. Which type is under discussion? "the type"
195                    // seems to refer to the "identical raw type". But a raw type by definition is not parameterized, so
196                    // this clause would seem to be superfluous and thus never apply, and so List<Number>[] :=
197                    // List<String>[] is OK. Oops.
198                    //
199                    // Or what if the "if the type is parameterized" clause means the receiver type itself and somehow
200                    // loosely the payload type as well? Well, clearly it cannot correctly do this, since an array type
201                    // is never a parameterized type. Same bad result. Oops.
202                    //
203                    // Or what if "identical raw type" really means "identical raw type (or identical component type if
204                    // they are array types)"? That would be most efficient, since it would rule out List<Number>[] :=
205                    // List<String>[] right off the bat: we wouldn't even get here. But that really doesn't seem to be
206                    // what is meant.
207                    //
208                    // What if the "if the type is parameterized" clause really means "if the type declaration used by
209                    // both the receiver and payload types is generic"? That would work. That's also equivalent to
210                    // something like: "...if at least one of the two arguments is a parameterized type [e.g. List<Number>,
211                    // not List<Number>[], not String, not List], or at least one of the two types is an array type with
212                    // a parameterized element type [e.g. List<Number>[], not List[], not String[]]..."
213                    //
214                    // That is the interpretation we apply here. So:
215                    //
216                    //   "...and, if the type [?] is parameterized..."
217                    //
218                    // becomes:
219                    //
220                    //   "...and, if at least one of the two type arguments is a parameterized type, or if at least one
221                    //   of the two types is an array type with a parameterized element type..."
222                    //
223                    // That, in turn, designates any type capable of properly yielding a raw type, while ruling out
224                    // those that can't! That means it is exactly equal to our yieldsRawType(TypeMirror) method, and so
225                    // that's what cdiParameterized(TypeMirror) returns.
226                    if (cdiParameterized(rta)) {
227                      assert cdiParameterized(pta); // ...because otherwise their raw types would not have been "identical"
228                      // "...the bean type parameter [argument] is assignable to the required type parameter [argument]
229                      // according to [all of] these rules [including 'matching']..."
230                      if (matches(rta, pta)) {
231                        continue;
232                      }
233                      yield false;
234                    } else {
235                      assert !cdiParameterized(pta);
236                      continue;
237                    }
238                  }
239                  yield false;
240                } else if (pta.getKind() == TypeKind.TYPEVAR) {
241                  // "...the required type parameter [argument] is an actual [non-type variable, non-wildcard reference]
242                  // type, the bean type parameter [argument] is a type variable and the actual [non-type variable,
243                  // non-wildcard reference] type [required type argument, receiver] is assignable to the upper bound,
244                  // if any, of the type variable [bean type argument, payload] [type variables have multiple
245                  // bounds]..."
246                  if (assignableToCondensedTypeVariableBounds((TypeVariable)pta, (ReferenceType)receiver)) {
247                    continue;
248                  }
249                  yield false;
250                } else {
251                  throw new AssertionError("Unexpected payload type argument kind: " + pta.getKind());
252                }
253              } else if (rta.getKind() == TypeKind.WILDCARD) {
254                // "...the required type parameter [argument] is a wildcard, the bean type parameter [argument] is an
255                // actual [non-type variable, non-wildcard reference] type..."
256                if (actual(pta)) {
257                  // "...and the actual [non-type variable, non-wildcard reference] type is assignable to the upper
258                  // bound, if any, of the wildcard and assignable from the lower bound, if any of the wildcard"
259                  if (assignableToExtendsBound((WildcardType)rta, (ReferenceType)pta) &&
260                      assignableFromSuperBound((ReferenceType)pta, (WildcardType)rta)) {
261                    continue;
262                  }
263                  yield false;
264                } else if (pta.getKind() == TypeKind.TYPEVAR) {
265                  // "...the required type parameter [argument] is a wildcard, the bean type parameter [argument] is a
266                  // type variable and the upper bound of the type variable [a type variable has many bounds?] is
267                  // assignable to or assignable from the upper bound, if any, of the wildcard and assignable from the
268                  // lower bound, if any, of the wildcard"
269                  if ((condensedTypeVariableBoundsAssignableToExtendsBound((WildcardType)rta, (TypeVariable)pta) ||
270                       condensedTypeVariableBoundsAssignableFromExtendsBound((TypeVariable)pta, (WildcardType)rta)) &&
271                      condensedTypeVariableBoundsAssignableFromSuperBound((TypeVariable)pta, (WildcardType)rta)) {
272                    continue;
273                  }
274                  yield false;
275                } else {
276                  throw new AssertionError("Unexpected payload type argument kind: " + pta.getKind());
277                }
278              } else if (rta.getKind() == TypeKind.TYPEVAR) {
279                if (pta.getKind() == TypeKind.TYPEVAR) {
280                  // "...the required type parameter [argument] and the bean type parameter [argument] are both type
281                  // variables and the upper bound of the required type parameter [argument] [a type variable has many
282                  // bounds?] is assignable to the upper bound [a type variable has many bounds?], if any, of the bean
283                  // type parameter [argument]"
284                  if (condensedTypeVariableBoundsAssignableToCondensedTypeVariableBounds((TypeVariable)pta, (TypeVariable)rta)) {
285                    continue;
286                  }
287                  yield false;
288                } else {
289                  throw new AssertionError("Unexpected payload type argument kind: " + pta.getKind());
290                }
291              } else {
292                throw new AssertionError("Unexpected receiver type argument kind: " + rta.getKind());
293              }
294            }
295            yield true; // we passed all the tests
296          }
297          yield false; // non-generic classes or raw types were not identical
298        }
299        default -> throw new AssertionError("Unexpected receiver kind: " + receiver.getKind());
300      };
301      // "A [non-generic or] raw bean type [payload] is considered assignable..."
302      case TypeMirror nonGenericOrRawPayload -> switch (receiver) {
303        // "...to a parameterized required type [receiver]..."
304        case DeclaredType parameterizedReceiver when parameterized(receiver) -> {
305          // "...if the[ir] [non-generic classes or] raw types are identical and all type parameters [arguments] of the
306          // required type [receiver] are either unbounded type variables or java.lang.Object."
307          yield
308            identical(nonGenericClassOrRawType(parameterizedReceiver), nonGenericOrRawPayload) &&
309            allTypeArgumentsAre(parameterizedReceiver.getTypeArguments(),
310                                ((Predicate<TypeMirror>)Assignability::unboundedTypeVariable).or(Assignability::isJavaLangObject));
311        }
312        // [Otherwise the payload is not assignable to the receiver; identity checking should have already happened in
313        // matches(), not here.]
314        case DeclaredType nonGenericOrRawReceiver when receiver.getKind() == TypeKind.DECLARED -> {
315          yield false;
316        }
317        default -> throw new AssertionError("Unexpected payload kind: " + payload.getKind() + "; receiver: " + receiver + "; payload: " + payload);
318      };
319    };
320  }
321
322  private final boolean identical(final TypeMirror receiver, final TypeMirror payload) {
323    // CDI has an undefined notion of "identical to".  This method attempts to interpret that.  Recall that
324    // javax.lang.model.* compares types with "sameType" semantics.
325    return receiver == payload || this.tes.sameType(receiver, payload);
326  }
327
328  // This test asks: is the *required type* assignable to the *bean type*'s bounds?
329  //
330  // @Inject Foo<String> foo; <-- Bean<T extends CharSequence> // is String (payload) assignable to CharSequence (receiver)?
331  private final boolean assignableToCondensedTypeVariableBounds(final TypeVariable receiver, final ReferenceType payload) {
332    assert receiver.getKind() == TypeKind.TYPEVAR;
333    assert actual(payload);
334    return covariantlyAssignable(condense(receiver), List.of(payload));
335  }
336
337  private final boolean assignableToExtendsBound(final WildcardType w, final ReferenceType candidate) {
338    assert w.getKind() == TypeKind.WILDCARD;
339    assert actual(candidate);
340    final TypeMirror extendsBound = w.getExtendsBound();
341    return extendsBound == null || covariantlyAssignable((ReferenceType)extendsBound, candidate);
342  }
343
344  // It's not immediately clear what CDI means by a type variable's upper bound. In javax.lang.model.type parlance,
345  // the upper bound of a TypeVariable could be an IntersectionType, which java.lang.reflect.TypeVariable represents
346  // as a collection of bounds. CDI blundered into this earlier: https://issues.redhat.com/browse/CDI-440 and
347  // https://github.com/jakartaee/cdi/issues/682
348  //
349  // "the upper bound of the required type parameter [receiver argument] is assignable to the upper bound, if any, of the bean
350  // type parameter [argument]" (when both arguments are type variables) should read:
351  //
352  // "for each bound, PA, of the bean type parameter [payload argument], there is at least one bound, RA, of the
353  // required type parameter [receiver argument], which is assignable to PA."
354  //
355  // The TCK enforces this, even though it's not in the specification (!).
356  //
357  // Weld's implementation confuses type parameters with arguments, just like the specification. They have a series of
358  // methods implemented as part of PR 614 (https://github.com/weld/core/pull/614) named "parametersMatch" [arguments
359  // match].
360  //
361  // Weld also has methods named things like "getUppermostTypeVariableBounds" and "getUppermostBounds". I think this is
362  // Weld's excruciatingly clumsy way of trying to express the JLS notion of "leftmost bound" (which is also
363  // undefined). See
364  // https://www.oreilly.com/library/view/learning-java-4th/9781449372477/ch08s07.html#learnjava3-CHP-8-SECT-7.1.
365  //
366  // Digging deeper, I think getUppermostTypeVariableBounds(tv) is just erase(tv) applied recursively, maybe?
367  //
368  // https://github.com/openjdk/jdk/blob/181845ae46157a9bb3bf8e2a328fa59eddc0273a/src/jdk.compiler/share/classes/com/sun/tools/javac/code/Types.java#L2450
369  //
370  // Compare vs.:
371  // https://github.com/weld/core/blob/e894d1699ff1c91332605f5ecae5f53410effb81/impl/src/main/java/org/jboss/weld/resolution/AbstractAssignabilityRules.java#L57-L62
372  //
373  // So maybe not quite. getUppermostTypeVariableBounds just gets to "actual" types. So T extends S, S extends String
374  // yields T extends String.
375
376  // For every bound in receiverBounds, after condensing, is there a bound in payloadBounds, after condensing, that is
377  // assignable to it using Java, not CDI, assignability semantics?
378  //
379  // Throws ClassCastException if, after condensing, any encountered bound is not either an ArrayType or a DeclaredType.
380  private final boolean covariantlyAssignable(final List<? extends TypeMirror> receiverBounds, List<? extends TypeMirror> payloadBounds) {
381    payloadBounds = condense(payloadBounds);
382    for (final TypeMirror receiver : condense(receiverBounds)) { // eliminate type variables via condense() call
383      if (!covariantlyAssignable((ReferenceType)receiver, payloadBounds)) {
384        return false;
385      }
386    }
387    return true;
388  }
389
390  // Is there a DeclaredType-or-ArrayType bound in condensedPayloadBounds that is assignable to classOrArrayTypeReceiver
391  // using Java, not CDI, assignability semantics?
392  //
393  // Throws ClassCastException or IllegalArgumentException if any encountered type is not either an ArrayType or a
394  // DeclaredType.
395  private final boolean covariantlyAssignable(final ReferenceType classOrArrayTypeReceiver, final List<? extends TypeMirror> condensedPayloadBounds) {
396    return switch (classOrArrayTypeReceiver.getKind()) {
397    case ARRAY, DECLARED -> {
398      for (final TypeMirror payload : condensedPayloadBounds) {
399        if (covariantlyAssignable(classOrArrayTypeReceiver, (ReferenceType)payload)) {
400          yield true;
401        }
402      }
403      yield false;
404    }
405    default -> throw new IllegalArgumentException("t: " + classOrArrayTypeReceiver + "; kind: " + classOrArrayTypeReceiver.getKind());
406    };
407  }
408
409  private final boolean covariantlyAssignable(final ReferenceType classOrArrayTypeReceiver, final ReferenceType classOrArrayTypePayload) {
410    assert actual(classOrArrayTypeReceiver);
411    assert actual(classOrArrayTypePayload);
412    return
413      classOrArrayTypeReceiver == classOrArrayTypePayload || // Optimization
414      this.tes.assignable(classOrArrayTypePayload, classOrArrayTypeReceiver); // yes, backwards
415  }
416
417  private final boolean condensedTypeVariableBoundsAssignableToExtendsBound(final WildcardType receiver, final TypeVariable payload) {
418    assert receiver.getKind() == TypeKind.WILDCARD;
419    assert payload.getKind() == TypeKind.TYPEVAR;
420    // "...the upper bound of the type variable [a type variable has many bounds?] is assignable TO [...] the upper
421    // bound, if any, of the wildcard..."
422    final TypeMirror extendsBound = receiver.getExtendsBound();
423    if (extendsBound == null) {
424      // WildcardType#getExtendsBound() javadoc: "If no upper bound is explicitly declared, null is returned."  This
425      // means the receiver is effectively java.lang.Object, and any reference type is assignable to it.
426      return true;
427    }
428    // Condense arguments to eliminate useless type variables and intersection types so that Java covariant semantics
429    // will work properly in this case.
430    return covariantlyAssignable(condense((ReferenceType)extendsBound), condense(payload));
431  }
432
433  private final boolean condensedTypeVariableBoundsAssignableFromExtendsBound(final TypeVariable receiver, final WildcardType payload) {
434    assert receiver.getKind() == TypeKind.TYPEVAR;
435    assert payload.getKind() == TypeKind.WILDCARD;
436    // "...the upper bound of the type variable [a type variable has many bounds?] is assignable [...] FROM the upper bound, if any, of the wildcard..."
437    final TypeMirror extendsBound = payload.getExtendsBound();
438    if (extendsBound == null) {
439      // "if any" is problematic. CDI implementations return true in this case.
440      return true;
441    }
442    return covariantlyAssignable(condense(receiver), condense((ReferenceType)extendsBound));
443  }
444
445  private final boolean condensedTypeVariableBoundsAssignableFromSuperBound(final TypeVariable receiver, final WildcardType payload) {
446    assert receiver.getKind() == TypeKind.TYPEVAR;
447    assert payload.getKind() == TypeKind.WILDCARD;
448    final TypeMirror superBound = payload.getSuperBound();
449    return superBound == null || covariantlyAssignable(condense(receiver), List.of(superBound));
450  }
451
452  private final boolean condensedTypeVariableBoundsAssignableToCondensedTypeVariableBounds(final TypeVariable receiver, final TypeVariable payload) {
453    assert receiver.getKind() == TypeKind.TYPEVAR;
454    assert payload.getKind() == TypeKind.TYPEVAR;
455    return covariantlyAssignable(condense(receiver), condense(payload)); // I think
456  }
457
458  private final boolean assignableFromSuperBound(final ReferenceType candidate, final WildcardType payload) {
459    assert payload.getKind() == TypeKind.WILDCARD;
460    assert actual(candidate);
461    final ReferenceType superBound = (ReferenceType)payload.getSuperBound();
462    return superBound == null || covariantlyAssignable(candidate, superBound);
463  }
464
465  // Get the raw type yielded by t, assuming t is the sort of type that can yield a raw type.
466  //
467  // An array type with a parameterized element type can yield a raw type.
468  //
469  // A declared type that is parameterized can yield a raw type.
470  //
471  // No other type yields a raw type.
472  private final TypeMirror rawType(final TypeMirror t) {
473    return switch (t.getKind()) {
474    case ARRAY -> {
475      final TypeMirror et = elementType(t);
476      if (!parameterized(et)) {
477        throw new IllegalArgumentException("t is an array type whose element type is not parameterized so cannot yield a raw type");
478      }
479      yield arrayType(erasure(et));
480    }
481    case DECLARED -> {
482      if (!parameterized(t)) {
483        throw new IllegalArgumentException("t is a declared type that is not parameterized so cannot yield a raw type");
484      }
485      yield erasure(t);
486    }
487    default -> throw new IllegalArgumentException("t is a " + t.getKind() + " type and so cannot yield a raw type");
488    };
489  }
490
491  // Return t if its element declares a non-generic class, or if it is the raw type usage of a generic class.
492  private final TypeMirror nonGenericClassOrRawType(final TypeMirror t) {
493    return yieldsRawType(t) ? rawType(t) : t;
494  }
495
496  // Erase t and return its erasure. Erasing is a complex business that can involve the creation of new types.
497  private final TypeMirror erasure(final TypeMirror t) {
498    return this.tes.erasure(t);
499  }
500
501  // Return a possibly new ArrayType whose component type is the supplied componentType.
502  private final ArrayType arrayType(final TypeMirror componentType) {
503    return this.tes.arrayTypeOf(componentType);
504  }
505
506
507  /*
508   * Static methods.
509   */
510
511
512  // If t is a TypeVariable whose bounds are, for example, S extends String, replaces S with String and returns a List
513  // whose sole element is String.
514  //
515  // If t is an IntersectionType whose first and therefore only permitted bound is, for example, S extends String,
516  // replaces S in the list of bounds with String instead.
517  //
518  // In all other cases returns List.of(t).
519  private static final List<? extends TypeMirror> condense(final TypeMirror t) {
520    if (t == null) {
521      return List.of();
522    }
523    return switch (t.getKind()) {
524    case INTERSECTION -> condense(((IntersectionType)t).getBounds()); // drop t; replace with its bounds
525    case TYPEVAR -> condense(((TypeVariable)t).getUpperBound()); // drop t; replace with its bounds
526    default -> List.of(t); // it doesn't have bounds, or it's a wildcard and we didn't say which bounds
527    };
528  }
529
530  private static final List<? extends TypeMirror> condense(final List<? extends TypeMirror> ts) {
531    if (ts == null || ts.isEmpty()) {
532      return List.of();
533    }
534    final TypeMirror t = ts.get(0);
535    return switch (t.getKind()) {
536    case INTERSECTION -> {
537      final ArrayList<TypeMirror> newBounds = new ArrayList<>();
538      newBounds.addAll(((IntersectionType)t).getBounds()); // replace the first element (t) with its bounds
539      newBounds.addAll(ts.subList(1, ts.size()));
540      newBounds.trimToSize();
541      yield condense(Collections.unmodifiableList(newBounds));
542    }
543    case TYPEVAR -> {
544      final ArrayList<TypeMirror> newBounds = new ArrayList<>();
545      newBounds.add(((TypeVariable)t).getUpperBound()); // replace the first element (t) with its bounds
546      newBounds.addAll(ts.subList(1, ts.size()));
547      newBounds.trimToSize();
548      yield condense(Collections.unmodifiableList(newBounds));
549    }
550    default -> ts;
551    };
552  }
553
554  // Does e represent a generic declaration?
555  //
556  // A declaration is generic if it declares one or more type parameters.
557  //
558  // Since an annotation interface cannot declare type parameters, it follows that TypeElements representing annotation
559  // instances are never generic.
560  private static final boolean generic(final Element e) {
561    return switch (e.getKind()) {
562    case CLASS, CONSTRUCTOR, ENUM, INTERFACE, METHOD, RECORD -> e instanceof Parameterizable p && generic(p);
563    default -> false;
564    };
565  }
566
567  // Is p generic?
568  //
569  // A Parameterizable is generic if it has one or more TypeParameterElements.
570  private static final boolean generic(final Parameterizable p) {
571    return !p.getTypeParameters().isEmpty();
572  }
573
574  // Is t the usage of a generic class, i.e. a usage (whether raw or parameterized) of a generic class declaration?
575  //
576  // t is deemed to be generic if it is a declared type whose defining element (its type declaration) is generic.
577  //
578  // Array types are never generic.
579  private static final boolean generic(final TypeMirror t) {
580    return t.getKind() == TypeKind.DECLARED && generic(((DeclaredType)t).asElement());
581  }
582
583  // Is t a parameterized type (and not a raw type)?
584  //
585  // A type is parameterized if it is a declared type with a non-empty list of type arguments. No other type is
586  // parameterized.
587  //
588  // "parameterized" means "supplies arguments for type parameters"
589  private static final boolean parameterized(final TypeMirror t) {
590    return t.getKind() == TypeKind.DECLARED && !((DeclaredType)t).getTypeArguments().isEmpty();
591  }
592
593  // There are some cases, but not all, where CDI considers an array type to be something that can be parameterized, or
594  // else "bean type parameter" resolution would never work. See
595  // https://stackoverflow.com/questions/76493672/when-cdi-speaks-of-a-parameterized-type-does-it-also-incorrectly-mean-array-typ.
596  private static final boolean cdiParameterized(final TypeMirror t) {
597    return yieldsRawType(t);
598  }
599
600  // Can t yield a raw type?
601  //
602  // To yield a raw type, t must be either:
603  //
604  // * an array type with a parameterized element type
605  // * a declared type with at least one type argument
606  private static final boolean yieldsRawType(final TypeMirror t) {
607    return parameterized(t) || t.getKind() == TypeKind.ARRAY && parameterized(elementType(t));
608  }
609
610  // Is t a raw type?
611  //
612  // A raw type is either "the erasure of a parameterized type" (so List<String>'s raw type is List, clearly not
613  // List<?>, and not List<E>) or "an array type whose element type is a raw type" (so List<String>[]'s raw type is
614  // List[]). (String is not a raw type; its element defines no type parameters.)
615  //
616  // No other type is a raw type.
617  private static final boolean raw(final TypeMirror t) {
618    return switch (t.getKind()) {
619    case ARRAY -> raw(elementType((ArrayType)t));
620    case DECLARED -> generic(t) && ((DeclaredType)t).getTypeArguments().isEmpty();
621    case TYPEVAR -> false; // called out explicitly just so you realize it
622    default -> false;
623    };
624  }
625
626  private static final boolean declaredTypeNamed(final TypeMirror t, final CharSequence n) {
627    return t.getKind() == TypeKind.DECLARED && named(((DeclaredType)t), n);
628  }
629
630  private static final boolean named(final DeclaredType t, final CharSequence n) {
631    // (No getKind() check on purpose.)
632    return ((TypeElement)t.asElement()).getQualifiedName().contentEquals(n);
633  }
634
635  private static final boolean allTypeArgumentsAre(final Iterable<? extends TypeMirror> typeArguments, final Predicate<? super TypeMirror> p) {
636    for (final TypeMirror t : typeArguments) {
637      if (!p.test(t)) {
638        return false;
639      }
640    }
641    return true;
642  }
643
644  private static final boolean isJavaLangObject(final Element e) {
645    return e.getKind() == ElementKind.CLASS && ((TypeElement)e).getQualifiedName().contentEquals("java.lang.Object");
646  }
647
648  private static final boolean isJavaLangObject(final TypeMirror t) {
649    return t.getKind() == TypeKind.DECLARED && isJavaLangObject(((DeclaredType)t).asElement());
650  }
651
652  // Is t an "actual type"?
653  //
654  // CDI mentions actual types but does not define what they are.
655  //
656  // A comment in a closed bug report (CDI-502)
657  // (https://issues.redhat.com/browse/CDI-502?focusedId=13036118&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels%3Acomment-tabpanel#comment-13036118)
658  // by one of the reference implementation's authors (Jozef Hartinger) provides the only definition:
659  //
660  // "An actual type is a type that is not a wildcard nor [sic] an unresolved [sic] type variable."
661  //
662  // More strictly, therefore, it seems an actual type is an array, declared or primitive type.
663  private static final boolean actual(final TypeMirror t) {
664    return switch (t.getKind()) {
665    case ARRAY, BOOLEAN, BYTE, CHAR, DECLARED, DOUBLE, FLOAT, INT, LONG, SHORT -> true;
666    default -> false;
667    };
668  }
669
670  private static final boolean unboundedTypeVariable(final TypeMirror t) {
671    return t instanceof TypeVariable tv && tv.getKind() == TypeKind.TYPEVAR && isJavaLangObject(tv.getUpperBound());
672  }
673
674  private static final TypeMirror elementType(final TypeMirror t) {
675    return t.getKind() == TypeKind.ARRAY ? elementType(((ArrayType)t).getComponentType()) : t;
676  }
677
678}
